text: Carfury is a hamlet in west Cornwall, England, United Kingdom. It is situated in Penwith approximately three miles (5 km) northwest of Penzance.Ordnance Survey: Landranger map sheet 203 Land's End It is in the civil parish of Madron The 19th-century geologist Elizabeth Carne founded a school in Carfury. Retrieved on 7 May 2008. There are three listed buildings in Carfury, all Grade II: Carfury farmhouse and its front garden walls, farm buildings west of Carfury farmhouse, and a piggery north of the farmhouse. ==Carfury Bible Christian Chapel== Carfury Bible Christian Chapel was founded in 1821 Retrieved 15 May 2012. with seating for 172. Retrieved 15 May 2012. From 1907 to 1932, the chapel was known as Carfury United Methodist Church. It closed and the premises were sold in 1971. Records and papers relating to the Carfury Chapel are held by Cornwall Record Office. ==References== ==External links== Category:Hamlets in Cornwall Category:Penwith
title: Carfury
